newsitem.title: CAMBODIA: Cambodia's Pol Pot captured -Khmer Rouge radio.
newsitem.headline: Cambodia's Pol Pot captured -Khmer Rouge radio.

text.p: Khmer Rouge strongman Pol Pot has been captured by his guerrilla comrades-turned enemies, the rebels said in a radio broadcast on Friday.
"Pol Pot has been captured," the radio, which is apparently run by the Khmer Rouge faction which broke with Pol Pot earlier this month, reported.
"The arrest of Pol Pot is a historic event and can finish the dictatorial regime," the radio said.
There was no immediate independent confirmation of the rebel radio report.

Earlier on Friday Cambodia's First Prime Minister Prince Norodom Ranariddh said a breakaway Khmer Rouge faction was closing in on Pol Pot who was holed up in a land-mine strewn mountain camp in northern Cambodia.

Pol Pot, whose 1975-79 Khmer Rouge government was responsible for the death of more than a million Cambodians, has not been seen in public since shortly after his overthrow at the hands of an invading Vietnamese army in 1978. REUTER sc rsb
